##### 6.3.4.3.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-48 .H6}

Two cells are deployed in the test, which are FR1 PCell (Cell 1) and a
FR1 neighbour cell (Cell 2) on the same frequency as the PCell. Test
configurations are given in Table 6.3.4.3.4.1-1. No measurement gap is
configured in the test case.

Both cell switch delay and interruption length are tested by using the
parameters in table 6.3.4.3.4.1-2, and 6.3.4.3.4.1-3.

The test consists of five successive time periods, with time durations
of T1, T2, T3, T4 and T5, respectively.

1\. Ensure the UE is in State RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release On according to TS
38.508-1 \[14\] clause 4.5. Establish SRB2 and DRB in the
RRCReconfiguration message. Cell 1 is the active cell.

2\. Set the parameters according to T1 in Table 6.3.4.3.5-1. Propagation
conditions are set according to Annex C clause C.2.2. T1 starts.

3\. The SS shall transmit an *RRCReconfiguration* message to configure
event A3 triggered measurement reporting on the intra-frequency carrier
of Cell 2 for Test 1A, 1B, 2A and 2B.

4\. The UE shall transmit *RRCReconfigurationComplete* message.

5\. The UE shall transmit a *MeasurementReport* message triggered by
Event A3. T1 ends with UE reporting an L3 measurement result of Cell2 to
Cell 1.

6\. The SS shall switch the power setting from T1 to T2 as specified in
Table 6.3.4.3.5-1. T2 starts.

7\. At the start of T2, the SS shall transmit an *RRCReconfiguration*
message with *LTM-Candidate-r18* for Cell 2, and SSB-based L1-RSRP
measurements and periodic L1-RSRP measurement reports for Cell 2 in
PUCCH format 2 for Test 1A, 1B, 2A and 2B.

8\. The UE shall transmit *RRCReconfigurationComplete* message.

9\. T2 ends with UE reporting a valid L1-RSRP result of Cell 2.

\- Test 1A and 1B: The SS shall switch the power setting from T2 to T3
as specified in Table 6.3.4.3.5-1. T3 starts.

\- Test 2A and 2B: T3 is skipped. The SS shall switch the power setting
from T2 to T4 as specified in Table 6.3.4.3.5-1 if the UE is capable of
*rach-EarlyTA-Measurement-r18*. T4 starts, go to step12. Otherwise, the
SS shall switch the power setting from T2 to T5 as specified in Table
6.3.4.3.5-1. T5 starts, go to step14.

10\. At the start of T3, the SS shall transmit a Candidate Cell TCI
States Activation MAC-CE (Refer to TS 38.321 \[12\], clauses 5.18.36,
6.1.3.76) of Cell 2.

\- In Test 1A, *CandidateTCI-State\#1* is activated.

\- In Test 1B, *CandidateTCI-State\#1* and *CandidateTCI-UL-State\#1*
are activated.

11\. T3 ends 50ms after the candidate cell TCI state activation MAC CE
transmission. And the SS shall switch the power setting from T3 to T4 as
specified in Table 6.3.4.3.5-1. T4 starts.

> \- For the UE that incapable of *rach-EarlyTA-Measurement-r18*, T4 is
> skipped. The SS shall switch the power setting from T3 to T5 as
> specified in Table 6.3.4.3.5-1. T5 starts, go to step14.

12\. At the start of T4, the SS shall transmit a PDCCH order (Refer to
TS 38.213 \[8\], clause 21, and TS 38.212 \[31\], clause 7.3.1.2.1) to
trigger the UE to transmit the PRACH on Cell 2 for Test 1A, 1B, 2A and
2B.

13\. T4 ends 5ms after the UE transmits the PRACH to Cell 2. And the SS
shall switch the power setting from T4 to T5 as specified in Table
6.3.4.3.5-1. T5 starts.

14\. The start of T5 is the instant when the last TTI containing the LTM
Cell Switch Command MAC-CE (Refer to TS 38.321 \[12\], clauses 5.18.35,
6.1.3.75) is sent by Cell 1 to trigger UE switches to Cell 2 for Test
1A, 1B, 2A and 2B. T5 starts.

\- In the cell switch MAC-CE:

\- The target cell is Cell 2.

\- Timing Advance Command is set to 0.

\- In test 1A, *CandidateTCI-State\#2* is indicated.

\- In test 1B, *CandidateTCI-State\#2* and *CandidateTCI-UL-State\#1*
are indicated.

\- In test 2A, *CandidateTCI-State\#1* is indicated.

\- In test 2B, *CandidateTCI-State\#1* and *CandidateTCI-UL-State\#1*
are indicated.

> \- Cell 2 continuously schedules PUSCH for the UE.

15\. T5 ends either at the UL slot of PUSCH scheduled by Cell 2 at the
first DL slot not earlier than (T~cmd~ + T~LTM-RRC-processing~ +
T~LTM-processing~ + T~first-RS~ + T~RS-proc~) after the beginning of T5
or upon the reception of PUSCH at Cell 2, whichever is earlier. The
values of T~cmd~, T~LTM-RRC-processing~ T~LTM-processing~,
**T~first-RS~** and T~RS-proc~ are specified in 6.3.4.3.5.

16\. If the UE transmits PUSCH to Cell 2 in less than D~LTM~ (= T~cmd~ +
T~LTM-interrupt~) ms from the beginning of time period T5, then the
number of successful tests is increased by one. Otherwise, the number of
failure tests is increased by one.

17\. After T5 expires, the SS sends an *RRCReconfiguration* with
*reconfigurationWithSync*, which includes the release of
*LTM-Config-r18*, to cause UE handover back to Cell 1.

18\. If UE is not in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release On according to
TS 38.508-1 \[14\] clause 4.5 on Cell 1, switch off and on the UE. Then
ensure the UE is in State RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release On according to
TS 38.508-1 \[14\] clause 4.5 on Cell 1.

19\. Power off Cell2 and set Cell 2 physical cell identity = ((current
cell 2 physical cell identity + 3) mod1008) for next iteration of the
test procedure loop. Upon setting the new physical cell identity for
Cell 2, power on Cell 2 to ensure Cell 2 is available for the following
test steps.

> 20\. Repeat steps 2-19 until the confidence level according to Tables
> G.2.3-1 in Annex G clause G.2 is achieved.

The UE shall start to transmit PUSCH to Cell 2 in no later than D~LTM~
from the beginning of time period T5.

The rate of correct cell switches observed during repeated tests shall
be at least 90%.

NOTE: The cell switch delay can be expressed as D~LTM~ (= T~cmd~ +
T~LTM-interrupt~), where:

T~cmd~ = T~HARQ~ + 3ms, as specified in TS 38.133 \[6\] clause 6.3.1.2.
T~LTM-interrupt~ = T~LTM-RRC-processing~ + T~LTM-processing~ +
**T~first-RS~** + T~RS-proc~ + T~LTM-IU~ is defined in TS 38.133 \[6\]
clause 6.3.1.3.

> \- **T~first-RS~** + T~RS-proc~=0 for Test 1A and 1B, **T~first-RS~**
> + T~RS-proc~=22ms for Test 2A and 2B.
>
> \- T~LTM-IU~ is the uncertainty in transmitting the first uplink
> transmission on Cell 2.

\- T~LTM-RRC-processing~ = 10 ms if the UE does not support
*ltm-FastProcessingConfig-r18*, otherwise T~LTM-RRC-processing~ =0ms

\- T~LTM-processing~ = 10 ms if the UE supports
*ltm-FastUE-Processing-r18* capability and UE reports 10 ms for
FR1-to-FR1 cell switch in the capability

\- T~LTM-processing~ = 15 ms if the UE supports
*ltm-FastUE-Processing-r18* capability and UE reports 15 ms for
FR1-to-FR1 cell switch in the capability

\- T~LTM-processing~ = 20 ms if the UE does not support
*ltm-FastUE-Processing-r18* capability.

#### 6.3.4.4 NR SA FR1 RACH-less Intra-frequency PCell switch from FR1 to FR1 without L1-RSRP measurement

##### 6.3.4.4.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-49 .H6}

To verify the requirement for the NR FR1-NR FR1 RACH-less
intra-frequency Pcell switch specified in 38.133 \[6\] clause 6.3.1
without L1-RSRP measurement and measurement reporting, including cell
switch delay and interruption length.

##### 6.3.4.4.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-49 .H6}

This test applies to all NR UEs supporting NR LTM for MCG with RACH-less
without L1-RSRP measurement and report from Release 18 onwards, and with
optional support for *rach-EarlyTA-Measurement-r18*. The test consists
of four parts, and the UE is required to pass one among Test 1A, Test
1B, Test 2A and Test 2B:

\- Test 1: for a UE that supports *ltm-MAC-CE-JointTCI-r18* and/or
*ltm-MAC-CE-SeparateTCI-r18*

\- Test 1A: for a UE that supports *ltm-MAC-CE-JointTCI-r18*.

\- Test 1B: for a UE that supports *ltm-MAC-CE-SeparateTCI-r18* and does
not support *ltm-MAC-CE-JointTCI-r18*.

\- Test 2: for a UE that does not supports *ltm-MAC-CE-JointTCI-r18* and
*ltm-MAC-CE-SeparateTCI-r18*

\- Test 2A: for a UE that supports *ltm-BeamIndicationJointTCI-r18*.

\- Test 2B: for a UE that supports *ltm-BeamIndicationSeparateTCI-r18*
and does not support *ltm-BeamIndicationJointTCI-r18.*

##### 6.3.4.4.3 Minimum conformance requirements {#minimum-conformance-requirements-48 .H6}

The minimum conformance requirements are specified in clause 6.3.4.0.

The normative reference for this requirement is TS 38.133 \[6\]
clause A.6.3.4.4.

##### 6.3.4.4.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-49 .H6}

Two cells are deployed in the test, which are FR1 PCell (Cell 1) and a
FR1 neighbour cell (Cell 2) on the same frequency as the PCell. Test
configurations are given in Table 6.3.4.4.4.1-1. No measurement gap is
configured in the test case.

Both cell switch delay and interruption length are tested by using the
parameters in table 6.3.4.4.4.1-2, and 6.3.4.4.4.1-3.

The test consists of five successive time periods, with time durations
of T1, T2, T3, T4 and T5, respectively.

1\. Ensure the UE is in State RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release On according to TS
38.508-1 \[14\] clause 4.5. Establish SRB2 and DRB in the
RRCReconfiguration message. Cell 1 is the active cell.

2\. Set the parameters according to T1 in Table 6.3.4.4.5-1. Propagation
conditions are set according to Annex C clause C.2.2. T1 starts.

3\. The SS shall transmit an *RRCReconfiguration* message to configure
event A3 triggered measurement reporting on the intra-frequency carrier
of Cell 2 for Test 1A, 1B, 2A and 2B.

4\. The UE shall transmit *RRCReconfigurationComplete* message.

5\. The UE shall transmit a *MeasurementReport* message triggered by
Event A3. T1 ends with UE reporting an L3 measurement result of Cell2 to
Cell 1.

6\. The SS shall switch the power setting from T1 to T2 as specified in
Table 6.3.4.4.5-1. T2 starts.

7\. At the start of T2, the SS shall transmit an *RRCReconfiguration*
message with *LTM-Candidate-r18* for Cell 2 for Test 1A, 1B, 2A and 2B.

8\. The UE shall transmit *RRCReconfigurationComplete* message.

9\. When T2 expires,

\- Test 1A and 1B: The SS shall switch the power setting from T2 to T3
as specified in Table 6.3.4.4.5-1. T3 starts.

\- Test 2A and 2B: T3 is skipped. The SS shall switch the power setting
from T2 to T4 as specified in Table 6.3.4.4.5-1 if the UE is capable of
*rach-EarlyTA-Measurement-r18*. T4 starts, go to step12. Otherwise, the
SS shall switch the power setting from T2 to T5 as specified in Table
6.3.4.4.5-1. T5 starts, go to step14.

10\. At the start of T3, the SS shall transmit a Candidate Cell TCI
States Activation MAC-CE (Refer to TS 38.321 \[12\], clauses 5.18.36,
6.1.3.76) of Cell 2.

\- In Test 1A, *CandidateTCI-State\#1* is activated.

\- In Test 1B, *CandidateTCI-State\#1* and *CandidateTCI-UL-State\#1*
are activated.

11\. T3 ends 50ms after the candidate cell TCI state activation MAC CE
transmission. And the SS shall switch the power setting from T3 to T4 as
specified in Table 6.3.4.4.5-1. T4 starts.

> \- For the UE that incapable of *rach-EarlyTA-Measurement-r18*, T4 is
> skipped. The SS shall switch the power setting from T3 to T5 as
> specified in Table 6.3.4.4.5-1. T5 starts, go to step14.

12\. At the start of T4, the SS shall transmit a PDCCH order (Refer to
TS 38.213 \[8\], clause 21, and TS 38.212 \[31\], clause 7.3.1.2.1) to
trigger the UE to transmit the PRACH on Cell 2 for Test 1A, 1B, 2A and
2B.

13\. T4 ends 5ms after the UE transmits the PRACH to Cell 2. And the SS
shall switch the power setting from T4 to T5 as specified in Table
6.3.4.4.5-1. T5 starts.

14\. The start of T5 is the instant when the last TTI containing the LTM
Cell Switch Command MAC-CE (Refer to TS 38.321 \[12\], clauses 5.18.35,
6.1.3.75) is sent by Cell 1 to trigger UE switches to Cell 2 for Test
1A, 1B, 2A and 2B. T5 starts.

\- In the cell switch MAC-CE:

\- The target cell is Cell 2.

\- Timing Advance Command is set to 0.

\- In test 1A, *CandidateTCI-State\#2* is indicated.

\- In test 1B, *CandidateTCI-State\#2* and *CandidateTCI-UL-State\#1*
are indicated.

\- In test 2A, *CandidateTCI-State\#1* is indicated.

\- In test 2B, *CandidateTCI-State\#1* and *CandidateTCI-UL-State\#1*
are indicated.

> \- Cell 2 continuously schedules PUSCH for the UE.

15\. T5 ends either at the UL slot of PUSCH scheduled by Cell 2 at the
first DL slot not earlier than (T~cmd~ + T~LTM-RRC-processing~ +
T~LTM-processing~ + T~first-RS~ + T~RS-proc~) after the beginning of T5
or upon the reception of PUSCH at Cell 2, whichever is earlier. The
values of T~cmd~, T~LTM-RRC-processing~ T~LTM-processing~,
**T~first-RS~** and T~RS-proc~ are specified in 6.3.4.4.5.

16\. If the UE transmits PUSCH to Cell 2 in less than D~LTM~ (= T~cmd~ +
T~LTM-interrupt~) ms from the beginning of time period T5, then the
number of successful tests is increased by one. Otherwise, the number of
failure tests is increased by one.

17\. After T5 expires, the SS sends an *RRCReconfiguration* with
*reconfigurationWithSync*, which includes the release of
*LTM-Config-r18*, to cause UE handover back to Cell 1.

18\. If UE is not in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release On according to
TS 38.508-1 \[14\] clause 4.5 on Cell 1, switch off and on the UE. Then
ensure the UE is in State RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release On according to
TS 38.508-1 \[14\] clause 4.5 on Cell 1.

19\. Power off Cell2 and set Cell 2 physical cell identity = ((current
cell 2 physical cell identity + 3) mod1008) for next iteration of the
test procedure loop. Upon setting the new physical cell identity for
Cell 2, power on Cell 2 to ensure Cell 2 is available for the following
test steps.

> 20\. Repeat steps 2-19 until the confidence level according to Tables
> G.2.3-1 in Annex G clause G.2 is achieved.

The UE shall start to transmit PUSCH to Cell 2 in no later than D~LTM~
from the beginning of time period T5.

The rate of correct cell switches observed during repeated tests shall
be at least 90%.

NOTE: The cell switch delay can be expressed as D~LTM~ (= T~cmd~ +
T~LTM-interrupt~), where:

T~cmd~ = T~HARQ~ + 3ms, as specified in TS 38.133 \[6\] clause 6.3.1.2.
T~LTM-interrupt~ = T~LTM-RRC-processing~ + T~LTM-processing~ +
**T~first-RS~** + T~RS-proc~ + T~LTM-IU~ is defined in TS 38.133 \[6\]
clause 6.3.1.3.

> \- **T~first-RS~** + T~RS-proc~=0 for Test 1A and 1B, **T~first-RS~**
> + T~RS-proc~=22ms for Test 2A and 2B.
>
> \- T~LTM-IU~ is the uncertainty in transmitting the first uplink
> transmission on Cell 2.

\- T~LTM-RRC-processing~ = 10 ms if the UE does not support
*ltm-FastProcessingConfig-r18*, otherwise T~LTM-RRC-processing~ =0ms

\- T~LTM-processing~ = 10 ms if the UE supports
*ltm-FastUE-Processing-r18* capability and UE reports 10 ms for
FR1-to-FR1 cell switch in the capability

\- T~LTM-processing~ = 15 ms if the UE supports
*ltm-FastUE-Processing-r18* capability and UE reports 15 ms for
FR1-to-FR1 cell switch in the capability

\- T~LTM-processing~ = 20 ms if the UE does not support
*ltm-FastUE-Processing-r18* capability.

### 6.3.5 LTM PSCell Switch

#### 6.3.5.0 Minimum conformance requirements

##### 6.3.5.0.1 Minimum conformance requirements for LTM PCell Switch

LTM cell switch delay D~LTM~ is the delay from the end of the last TTI
containing the MAC-CE command for cell switch until the time the UE
transmits the first UL message on the target cell.

The requirements in this section apply when

\- the target cell is known, and

\- the target joint UL/DL TCI state or separate UL and DL TCI states in
the MAC-CE LTM cell switch command are known, or

\- the target cell is an FR1 cell, and the UE has reported L3-RSRP
measurement result with SSB index associated to the target TCI state
within 5 seconds before receiving the LTM TCI state activation command,
and SNR of the SSB associated to the target TCI state ≥ -3dB.

LTM cell switch delay is defined as:

D~LTM~ = T~cmd~ + T~LTM-RRC-processing~ + T~LTM-processing~ +
**T~first-RS~** + T~RS-proc~ + T~LTM-IU~ ms

Where:

T~cmd~, T~LTM-RRC-processing~, T~LTM-processing~, **T~first-RS~**,
T~RS-proc~ and T~LTM-IU~ are as stated in ***TS 38.133*** \[6\] section
6.3.1.2.

The definition of known LTM target cell and the definition of known
***target joint DL/UL TCI state or separate DL and UL TCI states are as
stated in TS 38.133*** \[6\] ***in section*** 6.3.1.2.

##### 6.3.5.1.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-50 .H6}

To verify the UE\'s ability to perform NR FR1 RACH-based intra frequency
PSCell switch specified in 38.133 \[6\] clause 8.20 for both with and
without early TCI state activation.

##### 6.3.5.1.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-50 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UEs supporting NR LTM for SCG with
RACH from Release 18 onwards.

##### 6.3.5.1.3 Minimum conformance requirements {#minimum-conformance-requirements-50 .H6}

The minimum conformance requirements are specified in clause 6.3.5.0.

The normative reference for this requirement is TS 38.133 \[6\] clauses
8.20 and A.6.3.5.1.

The UE shall start to transmit the PRACH to Cell 3 in no later than
D~LTM~ from the beginning of time period T4.

The rate of correct cell switches observed during repeated tests shall
be at least 90%.

NOTE: The cell switch delay can be expressed as D~LTM~ (= T~cmd~ +
T~LTM-RRC-processing~ + T~LTM-processing~ + **T~first-RS~** + T~RS-proc~
+ T~LTM-IU~), where:

> T~cmd~ = T~HARQ~ + 3ms and is specified in clause 6.3.1.2

\- **T~first-RS~** + T~RS-proc~= 0 ms for Test 1A and 1B,
**T~first-RS~** + T~RS-proc~= 22 ms for Test 2A and 2B

\- T~LTM-IU~ = 20 ms

\- T~LTM-RRC-processing~ = 10 ms if UE does not support
*ltm-FastProcessingConfig-r18*, otherwise T~LTM-RRC-processing~ =0ms

\- T~LTM-processing~ = 10 ms if the UE supports
*ltm-FastUE-Processing-r18* capability and UE reports 10 ms for
FR1-to-FR1 cell switch in the capability

\- T~LTM-processing~ = 15 ms if the UE supports
*ltm-FastUE-Processing-r18* capability and UE reports 15 ms for
FR1-to-FR1 cell switch in the capability

\- T~LTM-processing~ = 20 ms if the UE does not support
*ltm-FastUE-Processing-r18* capability.
